text: let's talk about how to create investing goals this is probably one of the most overlooked aspects that all Traders just dismiss I did the same exact thing early on and it's a giant mistake because you do not realize how powerful it is to even take a few hours to create a roadmap so we're going to do exactly that right now what's up everybody Eric here welcome back to all outliers a big shout out to the YouTube members and the patreon folks if you're interested in joining and supporting you can find the links in the description below and with that let's get right to it so the very first thing there's gonna be five steps here and at the end the fifth step is going to walk us through some of the best practices that I've learned both from my personal experience but then also observing other people in their natural habitat working on these kinds of things so the very first one is one I reference all the time this is from Stephen covey's Seven Habits of Highly Successful People begin with the end in mind this is in the Marine Corps what we would call the desired end State what are we trying to do and most commonly it's some derivative of this replace my income people attempt to use invest testing and trading as a source of income so that they do not or not forced to work at a nine to five

text: call the desired end State what are we trying to do and most commonly it's some derivative of this replace my income people attempt to use invest testing and trading as a source of income so that they do not or not forced to work at a nine to five regular job okay got that one pretty easy The Next Step s eight replacing our income and we need to project it out in time and then we need to quantify things so these are the questions you have to ask yourself when are you attempting to replace your income with your investing income how much is your current income AKA how much investing income do you need what are your expenses and what are your margins this isn't necessarily used directly in these formulas I'm going to share in a little bit but it is more going to be a thing we want to track because that's going to be one of the the most impactful early levers you can pull on to get your desired outcome and then the last one is your future income preferences this one is super important because a lot of people when they're talking about this kind of planning they tend to be super super conservative they'll say things like oh I just want this or I just want that and maybe you do but maybe you don't who's to say that the right retirement for you is just Bare Bones as little

text: talking about this kind of planning they tend to be super super conservative they'll say things like oh I just want this or I just want that and maybe you do but maybe you don't who's to say that the right retirement for you is just Bare Bones as little as you possibly need but then you can't take vacations you can't buy that car that you want to get for me I definitely am far more interested in that fire financial Independence rep retire early is the Fire part but fat means you have a lot of money it means you get to do things so that's the very first juncture you're going to run up to here do you want to be fat meaning have a lot of money if so there's obviously burdens that come with that you're gonna have to figure out how to make more money save more money and you're probably gonna have a slightly longer Runway unless you hit it big which is okay but you have to identify truly for yourself what kind of retirement you prefer if it's a what we would call a moon fire exactly what it sounds like it's essentially Financial Independence retire early but lean you do it by cutting costs living a Frugal life and a lot of people are super fulfilled in doing that you got to pick what's right for you I definitely prefer fat fire but plenty of people do and live completely

text: make now how can we grow that and how much of it can we keep and then the last one this is another source of income for Traders which is your investing performance in my opinion I think you need to have at the very bare minimum Ultra minimum a five-year Runway of how you've done over the past five years with the objective being that in the more recent years on that that you're starting to get more consistent that part is super important because if you have a five-year trading history and it's all over the place you can't really plan off of that so that's why having a five-year minimum and if you get out of the gate running well your first year is whatever ever second year you're starting to get your feet under you and then the next three years are pretty bang on The Mark with what you're trying to do perfect most people it's going to be more than that but the reason why I say five year minimum is because it typically will give you enough looks at different markets to have a pretty fair idea but one of the things is if you are going through your planning cycle and let's say you did it in 2012 when we went through literally a 10-year bull market that's kind of difficult because you don't know how you're going to fare in a bear Market but that leads into some of our future

text: be adjusted to whatever you want I'm just using numbers so that's why these are like 10 200 200 1000 these are very easy for you to adjust to your current scenario so let's say we want 200 000 per year post taxes our current net worth is two hundred thousand dollars and your savings rate is one thousand dollars a month I will tell you right out of the gate that's way too low of a savings rate but I'm just throwing something out there based on these numbers at least okay so let's take a look at this scenario let's say that you're a Trader with at least five years of experience and in those five years you're averaging your compound annual growth rate is around 20 per year it means you're doing great so this is the growth phase of our account and then there's a maintenance phase the reason why I differentiate between these two is because I do not personally want to have to maintain essentially my Top Line performance into perpetuity in order to live off of it it's a very stressful way to do things so the way that I think about it is we have a growth phase where we're more aggressive more on top of it but then we ease off the gas once we start getting closer to our metric so that we can actually chill the out a little bit enjoy the stuff that we're working on so think

▬ ABOUT ERIK  ▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬
My name is Erik, I'm a Marine veteran, options trader, real estate and angel investor. From 2007, I spent over 30,000 hours honing my skillset and became a first generation millionaire before 30. I'm is passionate about self-development, life experiences, human performance, and helping others grow. I launched the esInvests YouTube channel and the Outlier community to share his experience and empower others to proactively craft their futures. 

DISCLAIMER:
The content presented is for informational purposes only and should not be considered as financial advice. esInvests, its affiliates, and employees are not responsible for any investment decisions made based on the information presented in these videos. All investment and trading activities involve risk, and viewers should carefully consider their financial situation, investment goals, and risk tolerance before making any investment decisions.

Any opinions, news, research, analyses, or other information contained in these videos are provided as general market commentary and do not constitute investment advice. esInvests does not guarantee the accuracy, completeness, or reliability of any information presented in these videos and is not liable for any losses or damages arising from the use of or reliance on this information. Viewers are encouraged to seek professional financial advice from a licensed investment advisor before making any investment decisions.

By accessing and watching these videos, viewers acknowledge and agree to these disclosures and terms of use.
